title.narrative: ECD Promotion Domestic Violence and Teenage Pregnancy Prevention in 3 Municipalities in the Region of Matagalpa

description.narrative: The Project will continue the promotion of Early Childhood Development. A new theme will be introduced with focus on prevention of domestic violence. In order to prevent child abuse new non-violent parenting methods and tailor made ways of educating childr en without using corporal punishment will be promoted. Agreements will be established with universities for psychological care for the victims of violence and child abuse. The project will strengthen stimulation circle initiatives for early learning suppor t groups women?s groups and work with parents and grandparents. The 3 peer support groups with adolescent mothers will continue and new groups will be started in accordance with the needs. The work with strategic partners will continue. The work of 20 alre ady existing women?s ECD groups will be enhanced and trained promoters will be assigned to each group with the integration of a total of 250 children of 0-5 yrs and their mothers. The work of peer support in the existing 3 groups for adolescent mothers wil l continue and when necessary more groups will be established. Three groups for women and girls victims of violence will be created to build up their self-esteem and provide psychological support. The work with grandmothers fathers and other male family me mbers will also continue promoting ECD and tackling the problems of domestic violence and child abuse. 10 groups for men against domestic violence will be established as well as 15 groups of adolescents addressing health issues with emphasis on violence pr evention and the health and social risks related to adolescent motherhood. The teenagers will also work on their personal plans for the future and structure their life plans. The project is expected to raise awareness among families and the direct benefici aries about child development care and education of their children practical knowledge of violence prevention and where to make formal complaints as well as how to get psychological support for the victims. In addition the aim is to enhance the process of raising men's awareness of the damages of macho behavior for their families. For teenagers the project aims at behavioral changes new ways of thinking and dealing in their relations with their families in addition to the work towards preventing teen pregna ncy and violence.
